subject: Politics
title: Transparency and Open Data
description: Learn Transparency and Open Data in one minute.

hook.text: Sunlight is the best disinfectant. When government data is public, corruption has fewer shadows to hide in.

buildup.text: Transparency means making government spending, contracts, and decisions publicly accessible and understandable.

discovery.text: Open budget initiatives in Brazil and South Korea let citizens track every dollar of government spending online.

twist.text: Transparency alone doesn't stop corruption. Without enforcement, publishing data just documents theft, not justice.

climax.text: The most effective systems combine transparency with accountability: public data plus institutions that act on it.

punchline.text: Transparency exposes corruption. Accountability stops it. You need both.

quiz.question: Why is transparency alone insufficient to fight corruption?
options: Without enforcement, publishing data just documents theft without consequences
Open data is too confusing for citizens to understand
